name: expectation
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the feeling that good things are going to happen in the future

example.eg: The holiday lived up to all our expectations (= was as good as we were expecting).
example.egtrans: 假期过得一点也没有让我们失望。

example.eg: I have high expectations for this job (= I believe it will be good).
example.egtrans: 我对这份工作的期望值很高。

example.eg: We did so well - beyond all (= better than) our expectations.
example.egtrans: 我们做得非常好——远远超过了我们的预期。

example.eg: I think she had unrealistic expectations of motherhood.
example.egtrans: 我觉得她对做妈妈的憧憬有些不切实际。

trans_examp.trans_en: the feeling of expecting something to happen

example.eg: Considering the injuries he's had there can be little expectation of him winning the race.
example.egtrans: 考虑到他的伤病，他赢得这场比赛的希望不大。

example.eg: Our expectations are that the UK will cut its interest rate.
example.egtrans: 我们预计英国会降低利率。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 出乎所有人的预料；意想不到的是

example.eg: Contrary to all expectations, she was accepted by the academy.
example.egtrans: 意想不到的是，她竟然被学院录取了。
